Description: Ostracon, large fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a pale-red pottery wine-jar, the fabric is light-brown/grey in section, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and very faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as wine.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393446) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393446)
